biography.value:
“Some find honor in a warrior's death, but others seek an everlasting place among those who fight on in undeath.”

Beyond Death.

A warrior who seeks lichdom does so in pursuit of glory in battle beyond death. These skilled fighters enter a bargain with an evil entity to evade the afterlife. Unlike wizards who seek arcane knowledge in their immortality, a warrior desires unmatched strength and prowess in battle. The arcane transformation causes a memori lich's physical form to decay but, in exchange, the undead form has supernatural strength and can call up fire to divide the battlefield. As with spellcasting liches that have individualized magical talents, each memori lich is unique.

Memento Skull.

To transcend death, a warrior drinks a toxic concoction mixed with the blood of a powerful creature poured into the skull of a defeated enemy. Drinking the fluid causes immediate death and transformation into a memori lich, whose soul is pulled into the skull.

The memento skull must be fed to sustain its magic. When a memori lich slays an opponent, the opponents fleeting spiritual energy feeds the memento skull through the memori lich. Most memori liches prefer stronger foes who have skills the lich can learn by consuming the stored energy.

Salvage p214[–]

A memori lich's skull can be a primary component for a @item[mace of disruption|DMG]. Someone who has proficiency with @item[smith's tools|PHB] can incorporate the skull into the mace, which takes 10 days and other materials worth 2,000 gp to make. The mace must also have @spell[dispel evil and good] cast on it at least three times during its making.

Lore p214[–]

[[/save ability=intelligence dc=10]] (&Reference[skill=History]):

A memori lich is a warrior who became immortal through eldritch means.

[[/save ability=intelligence dc=15]] (&Reference[skill=Religion]):

A memori lich has supernatural strength and prowess, along with resistances common to the undead. It takes magic weapons to effectively hurt one, and its form can't be changed.

[[/save ability=intelligence dc=25]] (&Reference[skill=Arcana]):

The magic that sustains a memori lich lies within a relic called a memento skull. To permanently kill the lich, one must destroy the skull.

A Memori Lich's Lair p214[–]

A memori lich might haunt an ancient battlefield or a fortress from which it can lead undead soldiers.

Lair Actions[–]

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the memori lich can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects. The memori lich can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

  • The ground within 120 feet of the memori lich shakes violently for a moment. Each creature of the memori lich's choice in that area must succeed on a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=16]] saving throw or fall &Reference[condition=prone].
  • Creatures of the memori lich's choice within 60 feet of the lich can't regain hit points until initiative count 20 on the next round.
  • Shades of those the memori lich has slain swirl around in a 30-foot sphere centered on the lich. This effect goes around corners. The shades help the lich, and so the lich rolls [[/r 1d4]] with the [[/r d20]] rolled for any ability check or saving throw, adding the number rolled on the [[/r d4]] to the result. The apparitions hinder those hostile to the lich and outline them with a faint glow. The area is &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} for such creatures, and they can't benefit from being &Reference[condition=invisible] while in the area. These benefits last until initiative count 20 on the next round.

description.value: The memori lich uses stunning presence and makes four attacks. The lich can use wall of fire in place of one attack.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+11]]{+11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 ([[/damage 4d6 + 5 type=slashing]]) damage.

Each creature of the memori lich's choice within 120 feet of and aware of it must succeed on a [[/save ability=wisdom dc=16]] saving throw or become &Reference[condition=stunned] for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the lich's Stunning Presence for the next 24 hours.

The memori lich creates a wall of fire on a solid surface within 120 feet of it. The wall can be up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts until the start of the lich's next turn. When the wall appears, each creature in its area must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=16]] saving throw, taking 27 ([[/damage 6d8 type=fire]]) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature takes 18 ([[/damage 4d8 type=fire]]) damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The memori lich takes one extra action.
A weapon deals two extra dice of its damage when the memori lich hits with it (included in the attack).
While at 94 or fewer hit points, the memori lich regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. This trait doesn't function while the lich has 0 hit points.
No effect can alter the memori lich's form.
If the memori lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

activation.condition: If the memori lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

description.value: If destroyed while its memento skull remains intact, the memori lich gains a new body in [[/r 2d4]] days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. Its new body appears within 5 feet of the memento skull.
The memori lich scores a critical hit on a roll of 18–20.
The memori lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.
The memori lich attacks with a weapon.
The memori lich moves up to its speed.

The memori lich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a [[/save ability=wisdom dc=16]] saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target can't move more than 30 feet from the memori lich and takes 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) extra necrotic damage if hit with the memori lich's weapon attack. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The effect otherwise ends in 1 minute, if the lich becomes &Reference[condition=incapacitated] or dies, or if the target dies. If the target dies, the lich regains 20 hit points.

This action has no effect on undead or constructs, but plants have disadvantage on the saving throw. Each creature within 20 feet of the memori lich must make a [[/save ability=constitution dc=16]] saving throw, taking 27 ([[/damage 6d8 type=necrotic]]) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The memori lich can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The memori lich regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

  • @UUID[Actor.JUm6KGC7884Y3TX5.Item.246PK3fxoVQ2taoX]{Attack}
  • @UUID[Actor.JUm6KGC7884Y3TX5.Item.ZnriMG6tvfuDY8Nw]{Move}
  • @UUID[Actor.JUm6KGC7884Y3TX5.Item.WSNQjH82D0VUOaa2]{Binding Curse}
  • @UUID[Actor.JUm6KGC7884Y3TX5.Item.a67UzyljS2g5Jcia]{Siphon Vitality (Costs 3 Actions, Recharge 6)}

The shades help the lich, and so the lich rolls [[/r 1d4]] with the [[/r d20]] rolled for any ability check or saving throw, adding the number rolled on the [[/r d4]] to the result. Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.
